metadata.description: Verb conjugations from Easy Kikuyu Facebook lessons by Emmanuel Kariuki - Batch 001 (past tense comparisons)

entries.english: I drank tea and ate bread
entries.context: Recent past tense - describing actions that just happened (moments ago)
entries.cultural_notes: Common everyday expressions for recent actions. Note the use of 'na' (and) to connect actions.

examples.english: I brought food to the table

grammatical_info.infinitives: kũnyua (to drink), kũrĩa (to eat), kũheha (to bring)

entries.english: I drank tea and ate bread
entries.context: Past tense - describing actions from early this morning
entries.cultural_notes: Note the different past tense marker compared to 'moments ago' - this indicates earlier in the day. Shows temporal distinction in Kikuyu verb conjugations.

examples.english: I brought food to the table

grammatical_info.comparison: Recent past uses 'nda-' prefix, morning past uses '-ire' ending
grammatical_info.infinitives: kũnyua (to drink), kũrĩa (to eat), kũheha (to bring)
